#summary Sesame Utilities

= Sesame Command Line Utilities =
[http://mutation-text-mining.googlecode.com/files/sesame-utils-1.0-jar-with-dependencies.jar Download]

Get help: java -cp target/sesame-utils-1.0-jar-with-dependencies.jar ca.unbsj.cbakerlab.sesame_utils.SesameCLI -?

Usage: SesameCLI [OPTIONS]
Options:
        --help -? 
                 Print this message.
        --task=[sparql,import] -t 
                Task to execute.
        --server=url -s 
                Sesame server URL.
        --repository=id -r 
                Repository name. If the repository does not exists, it will be created.
        --context=uri -c 
                Optional context (graph name) to load the data into.
        --user=name -u 
                User name for the Sesame server.
        --password=string -p 
                Password for the user on the Sesame server.
        --base-uri=uri -b 
                Optional base URI for the individuals and predicates in the RDF document being loaded.
        --query=path -o 
                Path to text file with SPARQl query - *.rq, *.sparql
        --input=path -i 
                Input file path.
        --output=path -o 
                Output file path.
        --count -n 
                Add number of results at the end of the query output.
        --pretty-format -f 
                Use only identifiers (no URI bases) in the query output.

Usage example:
java -cp benchmark/sesame-utils-1.0-jar-with-dependencies.jar ca.unbsj.cbakerlab.sesame_utils.SesameCLI \
-t add \
-i <input.rdf> \
-s <server-url> \
-r <repository-name> \
-c <context>
